markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Acrobatic Performer](/Feats.aspx?ID=2106) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 202 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1)

</column>

---

You're an incredible acrobat, evoking wonder and enrapturing audiences with your prowess. It's almost a performance! You can roll an [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) check instead of a [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) check when using the [Perform](/Actions.aspx?ID=59) action.
name: Acrobatic Performer

<summary>
Use Acrobatics to Perform.
</summary>
text: <title level="1" right="Feat 1" pfs="Standard" > Acrobatic Performer Source Advanced Player's Guide pg. 202 2.0 Prerequisites Trained in Acrobatics --- You're an incredible acrobat, evoking wonder and enrapturing audiences with your prowess. It's almost a performance! You can roll an Acrobatics check instead of a Performance check when using the Perform action.
